creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Byung Kang
description: sheer dark blue silk decorated with woven medallions over salmon-colored silk with woven dots and flowers; white collar
text: During the Joseon dynasty (1392–1897), male officials wore a round-collared robe called danryeong, with hyungbae, or rank badges (examples of which are on display nearby), sewn onto the chest and back of the robe. Dyed fabrics were imported from China, so colored garments were limited to the upperclass. The collar of this robe has a paper lining to keep its shape.
title: Man’s robe
